title: What are the best moments in presidential history? - Quora
tags: Political History of the United States of America
Presidents of the United States of America
History of the United States of America
Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: I don’t recall every President, but some do stand out. Lincoln’s Gettysburg Address; Jefferson’s Declaration of Independence; Monroe’s Bill of Rights and Constitution; Cleveland getting married in the White House (first Prez to be married there); Th. Roosevelt’s launching the Department of Parks and the Grand Opening of the Grand Canyon as a National Monument as well as The Panama Canal; Truman’s bombing of Japan (if it was only Hiroshima that was bombed, Japan was not going to surrender to Big Mac on the Missouri); Ike’s International Highway System; Kennedy’s launching of NASA; Reagan’s “Mr. Gorbachev, tear down this wall.”; Obama’s ObamaCare. I can’t think of one good thing about Trump, and I voted for that prick!
